poll_list.title: Ratification Poll for Protocol DAI Transfer to Fund IS-001 from Dec 2022 to May 2023 (MIP14c2-SP2) - January 9, 2023

discourse_list.title: MIP14c2-SP2: Subproposal for Protocol DAI Transfer to Fund ISCU from Dec 2022 to May 2023

content.content: MIP14c2-SP2: Subproposal for Protocol DAI Transfer to Fund ISCU from Dec 2022 to May 2023  Preamble MIP14c2-SP#: 2 Author(s): @psychonaut Contributors: @TravinImmunefi Tags:  Status: Accepted Date Proposed: 2022-12-02 Date ratified: 2023-01-23 Forum URL: https://forum.makerdao.com/t/mip14c2-sp2-subproposal-for-protocol-dai-transfer-to-fund-iscu-from-dec-2022-to-may-2023/19025 Ratification Poll URL: https://vote.makerdao.com/polling/QmbHM3fr --- Amount: 43,560 DAI   Specification  Sentence Reason This amount will sustain the team and services through May by which point we anticipate dissolving as a Core Unit and becoming an EndGame ecosystem actor.  Reason Details Since 24k MKR voted for Approve reduced budget - BearMarket, we request 6,600(6 months)(1.1 contingency) = 43,560 DAI.  Surplus Analysis As of 02 Dec 2022, our auditor wallet contained 740,396 DAI and 0.32 ETH. Assuming that our auditor returns the balance to the protocol then the proposed transfer can be taken from the current surplus.  DAI Transfer Ceiling Analysis The proposed transfer is well below the DAI Transfer Ceiling (250,000 DAI).  Targets Recipient is the Immunefi Security CU Auditor Multi-sig Wallet. Recipient Address: 0xd1F2eEf8576736C1EbA36920B957cd2aF07280F4 Amount To Transfer: 43560 DAI   Relevant Information:  Immunefi Security CU Update for November
content.GPT-summary: The post is a subproposal for a protocol DAI transfer to fund ISCU from Dec 2022 to May 2023. The author explains the proposal and provides details on the amount requested, the reason for the request, and the relevant information. A 3rd party extends to the proposal by providing entirely positive feedback. There is no indication of collaboration, advertising, or negative feedback.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
3rd party or author is advertising proposal

content.content: Not having the bounty program being tightly run is a risk to the protocol security. As a facilitator interacting with ISCU frequently, I have had a very good experience working through bug reports.
++ For 43k it makes sense to support an orderly transition of this program, and as stated, these funds are assumed to come from the existing CU’s funds.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal

content.content: To clarify, if this budget is approved, ISCU work is still continued till May 2023? That’s how I understand “keep the lights on” but correct me if I am misunderstanding.    Immunefi Security CU Update for November   Since it is not clear how to become an Ecosystem Actor, we plan a MIP55 SPF to provide six months of bridge funding to keep the lights on while the EndGame plan is fleshed out.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal
None of the topics listed match

content.content: Doo_StableLab:  if this budget is approved, ISCU work is still continued till May 2023   Yes, we apologize for our poetic language. Your clarification is, indeed, the intended interpretation.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
Author of proposal is asking for feedback

content.content: While we believe transition support is needed, we are cautious whether supporting till May is too long. Would it require 5 months to transition?

This is a summary of the contents of this subproposal and its impact, from GovAlpha’s perspective:  This is a valid subproposal to request a DAI transfer from the Maker Protocol to a target Ethereum address, as defined in MIP14: Protocol DAI Transfer. So far, all MIP14 requests combined do not exceed the MIP14c4: Protocol DAI Transfer Ceiling, which is currently set to 250,000 DAI. Therefore, this proposal is eligible. The last IS-001’s budget proposal was not approved by Governance. This request asks 43,560 DAI to fund IS-001’s continuity work for six months until May 2023. As per MIP14c2, this subproposal is eligible to enter the Monthly Governance Cycle, after having fulfilled its four-week Feedback Period and its one-week Frozen Period. If this subproposal is ratified, 43,560 DAI will be transferred to the specified MIP47-compliant multisig wallet through the earliest executive vote. This proposal has been assigned High-Impact based on the methodology listed here.  Disclaimer: These summaries are intended to be a guide and not a source of truth. You remain responsible for any actions you take on the grounds of this information. Please note the date when the summary was last updated to judge accuracy. Updated 2022-12-26
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal

content.content: My pet hamster, who is working pro-bono, would like to formally submit this MIP to the January cycle.
This proposal is currently being voted on. Its Ratification Poll will run until 2023-01-23. Please vote here.

This subproposal was successful. The team has confirmed they will be using DAI currently held in the IS-001 auditor wallet. Therefore, no additional distribution is required due to this proposal passing.
